title: Wavelet Applications in Economics & Finance by M&S Research Hub
description:
RLadies Delhi in collaboration with M&S Research Hub is organizing a 2 day workshop on Wavelet Applications in Economics & Finance.

Workshop Timings would be 1 PM - 5 PM on 19th and 20th Dec.

Content of the workshop
DAY-1
1. Introduction to R-Programming Language and R-studio Interface
2. The basic concept of Wavelet and its applications
3. Decomposition and plotting of the series using the MODWT method.
4. Wavelet Correlation
5. Wavelet Covariance
6. Cross-Wavelet Correlation

DAY-2
1. Continuous Wavelet Transform
2. Cross Wavelet Transform
3. Wavelet Coherence
4. Partial Wavelet Coherence
5. Introduction of MATLAB
6. Application of Continuous Wavelet Transform, Wavelet Coherence, Partial and Multiple Wavelet Coherence (Using MATLAB)

Each Participate will get certificate of enrollment.
Registration fees include the workshop material and data files.

If registered through RLadies you will get 30% off on registration fees.
If more than 10 RLadies would register, discount would be 50%, please do RSVP first to avail the discount.

For more details - https://ms-researchhub.com/home/conferences/wavelet-workshop.html

Last date of registration is 25th November 2019.

title: Quantile Estimations: Theory & Applications on R by M&S Research Hub
description:
RLadies Delhi in collaboration with M&S Research Hub is organizing a webinar on Quantile Estimation.

Registration fees include the workshop material and data files.

Material & Codes Fees: 25$
Please do RSVP first to avail the discount over the fees.

For registration - https://ms-researchhub.com/home/quantile-webinar-registration-page.html

title: HacktoberFest
description:
R-Ladies is organizing HacktoberFest in collaboration with DigitalOcean and TechTalks
https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com

Session Details/Agenda:
10:00 AM - 10:15 AM : Registration
10:15 AM - 10:30 AM: Intro to open source/Git
10:30 AM - 10:45 AM: Intro to Hacktoberfest
10:45 AM - 11:00 AM Workshop: how to contribute to open source
11:00 AM - 11:30 AM 3 Demos (10 minutes for each demos by anyone interested in sharing their open source projects.)
11:30 AM - 12:00 5 min for each community (to Present about the community)
12:00 pm - 1:00 pm: Lunch
1:00 pm - 5:30 pm: Start Hacking on HacktoberFest Issue Dev sprint (HackTime)
5:30 pm: - 5:45 pm: feedback
5:45 pm - 6:00 pm: Closing

When: Oct 20th, 2019 (Sunday) - 10:00 AM to 06:00 PM (Please be on time)

Where: 91springboard
Sec -2 Noida, UP
Near Noida Sector -15

How to Reach Venue:
- 900 m from Near Noida Sector -15
Google Maps - http://bit.ly/91sbnoidasec2

Note: Please keep your RSVP up to date.

Open for Community collaboration. Please reach out us at newdelhi@rladies.in

title: R-Ladies Delhi Meetup #1
description:
Hi all,
Glad to have you all here.

Note: Please keep your RSVP up to date, it is a very nice thing to do!

If you haven't yet, please go to https://forms.gle/avk8kLeFa2NkgnJ99 and fill in the survey to tell us a bit about yourself

Agenda:

Intro to Data Science and R-Ladies

Break, networking ..

Lightning Talks, Discussions

Hiring, pitches .. etc !

People who would like to volunteer to R- Ladies Delhi, please stay for a while after the meetups ends !

Logistics:
Manish Sisodia Camp’s office,IP extension, near Saraswati Kunj apartment, Delhi -110092

Nearest metro station is Mandawali west vinod nagar -5 min walk from there
Or Laxmi Nagar metro station - 15 min auto ride from there
Just mention Rasvihar apartment or Manish Sisodia’s Camp office
...

Please, unRSVP if you realise you can't make it. We're limited by space on the number of attendees, so please free up your place for your fellow community members!

Follow @RLadies Delhi ( https://www.facebook.com/RLadies-Delhi-111066293606859/?modal=admin_todo_tour ) for updates and early announcements. See you at the meetup!

Share your Lightning Talks! A "lightning talk" is a quick mini-presentation (5 minutes maximum) on any Machine Learning or R topic you'd like. We'll save time for 1-2 of these each month: to save a spot, post a comment with your talk's title/topic. Beginner topics are always welcome!

Presentations: If you'd like to share a topic with the group at an upcoming meetup, propose a talk here ( https://github.com/Anu-kriti/Rladies-Delhi ) :)

Contact:
Message us through the message tab on the meetup page, or ping here:

• Anukriti Gupta: +918882045065

title: [Virtual] Women in Data Science, WiDS Delhi
description:
Excited to share that we are going to have an amazing WiDS Delhi virtual conference in 2020 with the collaboration of R-ladies Delhi.

WiDS Delhi is an independent event organized by Anukriti Gupta and Riya Gupta to coincide with the annual Global Women in Data Science (WiDS) Conference held at Stanford University and an estimated 150+ locations worldwide.

All genders are invited to attend WiDS regional events, which features outstanding women doing outstanding work. This initiative aims to inspire and educate data scientists worldwide, regardless of gender, and to support women in the field.

Agenda of the conference-

2:00-2:30 pm
Introduction to WiDS and R-Ladies Delhi

2:30-3:45 pm
Hand on session on Language Models
Chirasmita Mallick - Principal Data Scientist at G2

3:45-5:00 pm
Product Recommendation using Apriori Algorithm
Nidhi Gupta - Senior Data Scientist at Pharmeasy

5:00-5:10 pm
10 min Break

5:10-6:25 pm
Hand on session Web Scraping
Ankita Saraf - Volkswagen AG

6:30-7:15 pm
Quantum Computing
Denise Ruffner- Chief Business Officer at CQC

The session would be conducted online on Zoom. The meeting link will be shared soon.

RSVP if you want to learn from these amazing speakers.

https://us02web.zoom.us/j/83721455786

title: [Virtual] Data Science in Entertainment Industry
description:
Hi all,

Our next virtual session is around the data science application in the Entertainment Industry.

Our speaker will take you through - How OTT platforms leverage Data Science in picking up the patterns in consumer behavior and content consumption to building models leading to higher engagement and ROI.

Speaker of the session:- Rachana Bagde
Data Science Manager @ALTBalaji - leading OTT platform.
Former Founder & CEO - G for Gestures

The session would be conducted online on Webex.

https://optumtech.webex.com/optumtech/j.php?MTID=mebfef89895e33407aad9a82630fa048a

RSVP if you would be meeting with us there.

title: Application of Survival Analysis

You will learn about Statistical as well as Machine learning Models on Survival analysis prediction modeling

https://meetingsapac16.webex.com/meetingsapac16/j.php?MTID=mb25a368a85d936d91c67ae00f42f88f4

For joining the event you need to install Webex-

title: Visualizing Data with R: An R-Ladies Introduction
description:
Join us for the R-Ladies New Delhi Chapter Meetup! This session is designed to introduce new members and attendees to the R programming language and the mission of R-Ladies, a global organization promoting gender diversity in the R community.
The event will feature:

1. **Introduction to R-Ladies and R Programming:** Learn about the community and how R can empower your data analysis skills.
2. **Hands-on Workshop:** Dive into data visualization using popular R libraries.

**What to Bring:**

1. A laptop (optional but encouraged for the hands-on session).
2. **Snacks:** Light snacks will be provided, courtesy of the [Cluster Innovation Centre](https://cic.du.ac.in/), University of Delhi.
This is a great opportunity to learn, network, and explore the potential of R. Beginners and experienced R users alike are welcome!
For any questions, contact Kritika Verma at **kritikaverma2707@gmail.com**.
We look forward to seeing you there!

venues.name: Cluster Innovation Centre
venues.address: Rugby Sevens Building, University Stadium, University of Delhi, G.C Narang Marg, Delhi, 110007
